t: To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
Hear*pn my voice, O God, in my complaint; preserve*ld my life from dread of the enemy.
Hide*ln me from the secret plots of the wicked, from*ld the throng of evildoers,
who*ln whet their tongues like swords, who*ld aim bitter words like arrows,
shooting*ln from ambush at the blameless, shooting*ld at him suddenly and without fear.
They*ln hold fast to their evil purpose; they*ld talk of laying snares secretly, thinking,*ln “Who can see them?”
They*ld search out injustice, saying,*ln “We have accomplished a diligent search.” For*ld the inward mind and heart of a man are deep.
But*pn God shoots his arrow at them; they*ld are wounded suddenly.
They*ln are brought to ruin, with their own tongues turned against them; all*ld who see them will wag their heads.
Then*ln all mankind fears; they*ld tell what God has brought about and*ld ponder what he has done.
Let*pn the righteous one rejoice in the Lord*s and*ld take refuge in him! Let*ln all the upright in heart exult!
